snippet: The reigning Australian Open winner Li Na, who became the first Grand Slam titlist from Asia by winning the 2011 French Open, announced her retirement in a letter posted on social media.
abstract: Former French Open and Australian Open champion Li Na, first Asian player to win a Grand Slam singles title, announces she is retiring because of worsening of knee injuries.
lead_paragraph: The reigning Australian Open winner Li Na, who became the first Grand Slam titlist from Asia by winning the 2011 French Open, announced her retirement in a letter posted on social media.

headline.main: Li Na, Two-Time Major Winner, Is Retiring With Knee Woes
headline.print_headline: Li, Two-Time Major Winner, Is Retiring With Knee Woes
